steps.text: In a mixing bowl, add 1 cup of gram flour (besan).
Add 1/2 teaspoon of red chili powder, 1/4 teaspoon of turmeric powder, 1/2 teaspoon of cumin powder, and salt to taste.
Add 1/2 cup of water gradually and mix to form a smooth batter.
Cut 200 grams of paneer into small cubes.
Dip each paneer cube into the batter, ensuring it is coated well.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan.
Carefully drop the coated paneer cubes into the hot oil.
Fry until the paneer pakodas turn golden brown and crispy.
Remove from the oil and drain on a paper towel to remove excess oil.
